review: It keeps loosing the wifi signal and then cannot locate any wifi when there are at least 3 in the vicinity. author: sandra m gault

review: It is impossible to speak about Fire TV Stick without comparing it to Roku. It looks pretty much the same, works pretty much the same, only remote is slightly better (my opinion). 5 GHz wireless wass pretty much broken and I couldn't get it to work (this seems to be a pretty common complaint). However, 2.4 GHz works ok. USB connector is on the side - some people will love it, some people will hate it - depending on HDMI connector orientation.User interface is reminiscent of Windows Media Center and works reasonably good. If you used anything like this in last few years, you'll adjust easily.Unfortunately, for those hopping to use Miracast, this stick won't be suitable since you need to get into menus to turn it on and it works only while that screen is opened. So forget about spur of the moment sharing - every time you will need to get into settings to turn it on once again.It is not that this stick is bad, but I personally find Roku slightly more comfortable and user friendly so, unless you can get this stick at a cheap price, I would pass.
